how_to_setup_client:
Setting Up CoreStudio Client

  • Requirements
    • Active internet connection
    • Access to corestudio repository

Configuring environment

1. Install Node and NPM

Install nodejs on your machine. Instructions

NOTE: npm will be installed with the node.

NOTE: CoreStudio has node-sass dependency and the build may break if built with unsupported node version. Please see Node version support policy for node-sass.

2. Install Yarn [Optional]

Install yarn package manager on your machine.

npm i yarn

If you face any issues OR want to try alternate ways, you can follow these instructions

3. Install vue-cli

Install vue cli tools.

npm install -g @vue/cli # ORyarn global add @vue/cli

Clone repository

Default branch - devbranch

  • Repository URL

1. For development

cd path/to/your/workspace git clone https://corelab.mkcl.org/MKCLOS/coreosv3/corestudio.git

2. For building

This ignores the git history and just downloads source files.

cd path/to/your/build/dir git clone --depth 1 -b devbranch https://corelab.mkcl.org/MKCLOS/coreosv3/corestudio.git

Installing dependencies

cd /path/to/repository/client/CoreStudio npm install # OR yarn add

Running client

cd /path/to/repository/client/CoreStudio npm run serve # OR yarn serve

This will run corestudio at http://localhost:8080

Building client

cd /path/to/repository/client/CoreStudio npm run build # OR yarn build
test: cd /path/to/repository/client/CoreStudio npm run build # OR yarn build
setup_coresls:
Setting Up Coresls

  • Requirements
    • Active internet connection
    • Access to coresls repository
    • Git
    • GCC on windows
    • Go installation (version 1.13+)

Clone repository

Default branch - devbranch

  • Repository URL

For development

cd path/to/your/workspace  git clone https://corelab.mkcl.org/MKCLOS/coreosv3/coresls.git

For building

This ignores the git history and just downloads source files.

cd path/to/your/build/dir  git clone --depth 1 -b devbranch https://corelab.mkcl.org/MKCLOS/coreosv3/coresls.git

Download dependencies

cd path/to/your/workspace/coresls go mod download

Additional setup

  • Coresls uses rice to embed files in executables. We can download and install it with following command.

    GO111MODULE=off go get github.com/GeertJohan/go.rice/rice

On windows

Coresls uses following tools to build executables and installers.

  • goversioninfo to embed meta information and icons in executables. We can download and install it with following command.

    GO111MODULE=off go get github.com/josephspurrier/goversioninfo/cmd/goversioninfo

  • NSIS for installers.

  • SignTool to sign executables.

  • CoreSLS/CoreStudio can not build go programs in plugin mode on windows. If you want to do so, you can setup wsl environment and follow same setup steps.

  • How to build
  • How to execute

    • GCC on windows
    • Go installation (version 1.13+)

Clone repository

Default branch - staging

  • Repository URL

Note: devbranch is used to make the changes and staging(default) is used for release purposes.

Download dependencies

cd path/to/your/workspace/corepkgv2go mod download
